sentences.english: Bu Shao’s mother, a high school teacher, has misgivings.
sentences.chinese: 但是邵的中學教師媽媽有疑慮。

sentences.english: There's no doubt in your mind about his aim ?
sentences.chinese: 對他的目的你心裏不存疑慮吧？

sentences.english: Many business owners are still uneasy about hosting sensitive data off-site.
sentences.chinese: 許多企業主至今仍然對託管敏感數據心存疑慮。

sentences.english: But there must be some doubt how effective these initiatives will be.
sentences.chinese: 但對於這些措施有多大效果，人們肯定存在一些疑慮。

sentences.english: She has her doubts about loaning him more money.
sentences.chinese: 她對是否再借錢給他不無疑慮。

sentences.english: Perhaps so, but I have my doubts.
sentences.chinese: 或許可以，但我有自己的疑慮。

sentences.english: In that regard, Liu said USD depreciation is also a concern.
sentences.chinese: 由是觀之，劉也表示，美元的貶值也是疑慮之一。

sentences.english: An awful flicker of doubt appeared in her eyes.
These concerns are both perfectly legitimate issues for China to raise.
sentences.chinese: 站在中國的立場上，提出這些疑慮無可厚非。

sentences.english: Some in the Senate also quietly whispered their misgiving.
sentences.chinese: 議會中的某些人也悄悄地表達了他們的疑慮。

sentences.english: My duff transcript did not faze the schools I applied to.
sentences.chinese: 我那份改頭換面的成績單，並沒有引起商學院的疑慮。

sentences.english: Therefore, enterprises, the effect of the ads are often hard doubt.
sentences.chinese: 因此，企業對於硬廣告的效果往往心存疑慮。

sentences.english: He looked with misgiving at the strange food on his plate.
sentences.chinese: 他用疑慮的眼光看看他碟子上奇怪的食物。

sentences.english: The EarlyBird team really force us to question our comfortable assumptions regarding childhood obesity.
sentences.chinese: 晨鳥小組確實令我們對兒童肥胖的經典假設開始疑慮。

sentences.english: T-1. II. 1. Revelation induces complete but temporary suspension of doubt and fear.
sentences.chinese: 啓示能一時卻全面撤銷人的疑慮及恐懼。

sentences.english: It is possible to liquidate their doubts.
sentences.chinese: 消除他們的疑慮是有可能的。

definition: to call into question/to question (truth or validity)
to be deeply concerned/to be troubled (by)
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to call on (sb to do sth)/to appeal (to)/an appeal
